com.dhemery.expressing
Class Evaluations

java.lang.Object
  com.dhemery.expressing.Evaluations
Direct Known Subclasses:
Expressive
public class Evaluations
extends Object

Builds fluent expressions to make assertions and evaluate boolean conditions. In contrast to the methods in other Expressiveâ€“related classes, these methods evaluate expressions immediately, without polling. These methods are all declared static, so they can be used without instantiating an Expressive.

public static void assertThat(String context,
                              boolean value)

public static <T> void assertThat(T value,

is

public static <S> org.hamcrest.Matcher<S> is(S value)
Create an implicit "equalTo" matcher, decorated to make it more expressive. Delegates to Matchers.is(Object).
